definition:
Let $\Gamma$ denote the gamma function, $\zeta$ the Riemann zeta
function and $s$ any complex number. Then

$$\begin{aligned}
\pi^\frac{s-1}{2}\Gamma\left(\frac{1-s}{2}\right)\zeta(1-s)=\pi^{\frac{-s}{2}}\Gamma\left(\frac{s}{2}\right)\zeta(s).\end{aligned}$$

Though the equation appears too intricate to be of any use, the inherent
in the formula makes this the simplest method of evaluating $\zeta(s)$
at points to the left of the critical strip.
phrase: Functional Equation Of The Riemann Zeta Function
